Reviews.Content: This machine is a great value. The battery life is about eight hours as long as you don't have the screen on full brightness. It also has an intel processor which makes running Linux or some other operating system on it very accessible.

Reviews.Title: The Best Laptop For its price
Reviews.Author: Matthew Cooper
Reviews.Content: PROS-  This laptop is amazing! It does everything you would do in a normal desktop computer, but it is a fraction of the price! Everything about it it perfect. We use the hdmi port on the side to watch Netflix on out TV. Chrome OS is very nice and easy to use.Over all the laptop is Great!CONS- There are not very many bad things about this laptop. The keyboard feels a little weird and the speakers are on the bottom of the laptop. But you will get used to both.So, other than that, it is a great laptop and i strongly recommend that you buy!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic alternative to a Laptop and/or a Tablet
Reviews.Author: WLT
Reviews.Content: Basically, this is an Android Tablet without a Touch Screen and with a Keyboard Attached.  You get 2 gig of operating memory and 16 gigs of app memory for your apps and music and movies.  There is a full SD card port on the side, as well as an HDMI output and two USB Ports.Also, there are decent speakers (Stereo) and a Mini Cell Phone type port for using your Headphones with Mic.  Yes, it has a mic/speakers and camera built in, but you can also plug in your Smartphone Headset and listen or make calls with Google Voice.It's lightning fast OS (Android) compared to my old Windows Laptop, AND, everything happens in the cloud (Google Drive).  You have to print via cloud. There is no printer output.  It does have Bluetooth as well as Wifi. Screen resolution and brightness are GREAT.If you want a cool and useful alternative to your Laptop and/or Tablet while mobile, this may be it.  Google has done a great job with this OS.  It does the basics and is economical - AND - the battery lasts for 8 hours or more!  You can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: a
Reviews.Author: Eddie Ramos
Reviews.Content: Very nice laptop. Use it mainly for movies but also has Microsoft office. Good size and good price. No problems since I've bought it. Also you can download apps just like a phone can.

Reviews.Title: Drops wi-fi constantly
Reviews.Author: QC
Reviews.Content: At least the model that I purchased did not connect to wi-fi networks in a stable manner. It kept dropping from the network constantly -- unlike my MacBook, which is always connected to the internet without any problem.

Reviews.Title: Love it, gifted one already
Reviews.Author: Andrew Latham
Reviews.Content: As an Open Source advocate I wanted to try a Chromebook. I liked the specs and feel of the C720. I ordered one for myself and use it often. I also ordered one for my nephew as a gift. Very light, long battery life, great screen, nice keyboard, HDMI and some other useful ports. It was a bit hard but I did find a spare power supply here on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs and well worth the price.
Reviews.Author: A.Fenderson
Reviews.Content: I've tried using my smartphone and a couple of Android tablets as devices to surf the web on while watching TV, and none of them ever gave me an enjoyable experience:  while two of them actually had slightly higher resolution screens than this Chromebook, none of them were easy to navigate for me due to links being too small to easily click on and my strong preference for physical versus virtual keyboards.  So I wanted a small, light laptop that would allow me to surf the web while getting the benefits of a laptop vs tablet (touch type and precision pointer/click control).  This Chromebook fits all of my needs easily.  I get over 7 hours on a single charge (though unfortunately my battery level and charge-time indicators are somewhat inaccurate), and web pages load very quickly even on a 802.11-g router that's connected to slowish DSL.  I plugged a USB headset into this and was able to use it to do a Google video call in combination with the built-in 720p webcam with no driver install process or setup issues at all.  I use this at home, work, and the homes of family members, and it seamlessly transitions between wifi access points.  I did encounter one issue that only ever happened on an AT&T; DSL connection where images and pages sometimes were timing out or not loading, seemingly due to DNS issues, as though the browser were giving up too quickly to resolve and/or load, but hard-setting DNS to always use Google's servers seems to have fixed that issue.  Which brings up a good point:  for those willing to use Google and do some tinkering, even without installing Linux there are lots of settings and tools you can use to get a bit more functionality and customization than what the standard ChromeOS interface provides.Two issues worth mentioning:  any SD card will stick about half-way out of the card slot, which is unfortunate.  After extensive searching, it seems that there is no current micro-SD to full-size SD adapter that will fit completely within the slot, either.  The screen is also somewhat low-end:  while the resolution has not yet been a problem at all, the viewing angles and blue-haze common to low-end LCD panels are both very apparent here.  I sometimes find myself tilting the screen to odd angles in an attempt to mitigate the viewing-angle problem, but it's a minor inconvenience overall.  Watching 720p/HD streaming shows/movies is entirely possible thanks to the decent CPU/GPU, but the picture quality, especially in darkish scenes, will suffer on this screen.  Luckily, there is also a full-sized HDMI out port that you can use to connect to a better monitor or TV when available.

Reviews.Title: My New Favorite Mobile Device
Reviews.Author: 50yardliner
Reviews.Content: I bought this because some teachers in my District (where I help advise for school technology purchases) were interested in the Chromebook.  I read reviews but I had to get one myself to truly understand what it could do and not do.The verdict: I love it! For most students in the core subjects, it will do just fine! For people that are using specialized software, this isn't the device because you can't install software on this. Basically, if you can find what you want on the Internet without having to install anything to run the application, you are good to go on this device! The web tools that can't be used on here due to needing JAVA or similar software have some type of alternative on the Google App Store for free - at least what I needed. As far as storage limitations, you can always get additional cloud storage through Dropbox.  For a student that can afford to delete files or upload to other cloud storage solutions, I say go for it. I'm not planning on activating the 2 years of extra storage.  Therefore I am not going to be concerned with having to pay a fee in 2 years.For word processing, presentations, etc., you can use Google Drive or Microsoft's version - OneDrive.  There's lots of free web apps out there so most people won't miss the fact that you can't download software.Limitations:  It took me a little time to get used to the mouse and the fact there is no delete key.  But once you get used to it, it's no big deal.It's lightweight, has awesome battery life....I can't say enough about this device.  It's my new favorite toy!

Reviews.Title: Here is what you get
Reviews.Author: Bobby Harakat
Reviews.Content: for 200 bucks you get a chrome internet browser with all chrome web aps such as note and spread sheet...sounds a bit dull but that's only what comes stock (which is ample enough for the regular web surfer user)using crouton script you can install a plethora of different Linux distributions which will allow you to do pretty much anything you want, so long as what you want does not exceed the hardware limitations. using Linux Unity with Ubuntu GUI i am able to use this to play some video games via wine (nothing too fancy since you dont have a GPU) I am able to do my homework using Libre Office tools and even use programming software compilers for VB and C++if it sounds a little techy for you don't worry, installig linux and making this computer into more than a web browser is very easy , just look up how to install linux on youtube(WARNING INSTALLING LINUX VOIDS WARRANTY)

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 is a screamig fast Chromebook at a fantastic price
Reviews.Author: Alpine-X
Reviews.Content: I wont rehash all that others have said, but to sum it up... It's :Light weight and thin (drops into a backpack like its not there.Runs SilentRuns coolKeyboard and Touchpad are very niceScreen is good, but not Fantastic (I wish there was a contrast adjustment). The viewing angle is fairly narrowBattery life is FANTASTICSound is goodOperation is great, runs smooth, fast, boots in seconds, full screen video is smooth, connects to WIFI easilyGoogle Chrome works great for 99% of what I do ( I haven't used my other laptop or tablet in two weeks)printing to my wireless Epson 410 is a breeze with Google Cloud Printpick yourself up a Caselogic LAPS 111 neoprene sleeve to protect it while out and about....and your good to go..

Reviews.Title: Perfect for kids
Reviews.Author: S. Koehler
Reviews.Content: My kids love them.  They have their own "laptop" now for games and such.  Now they will stay off mine.  Bought them for Christmas in 2013 and they are still in great shape.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a laptop!
Reviews.Author: DIYDanielle "DIYDanielle"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my mother-in-law who isn't very computer savvy and she didn't want to take it (just because it seems like an expensive purchase), but we've been using it and it works great. I think this is perfect for older generation who just barely were understanding computers before Windows8 came out and f'ed up their lives. My mother needs one... she cannot figure out Windows 8 and we're so tired of doing "tech support" for both our parents. Completely worth the $150 these refurbished computers cost. It's very lightweight with a smaller monitor on it so keep that in mind. I do think getting the bigger monitor might be helpful for older generation so they don't have issues seeing the screen.This is not great if you want to do a LOT with it... we play a lot of video games that play in high resolution and we tend to buy higher end computers as a result. There's no touch screen. We do love Google though so this system is really nice in that respect... we use a LOT of google products and it's very friendly to doing that.I see this also as a great alternative to getting a tablet. It's small enough to keep beside you to do a quick search or let the kids play a web based game (we use a learning website for our 30 month old and I think this would work well for that). My 30 month old thinks this is "his" computer now and likes to carry it around the house. He's got the mousepad figured out easily. I've seen they have protective covers you can buy for them (like a cell phone case) that we might pick up if our mother-in-law won't accept this.

Reviews.Title: My favorite computer to use.
Reviews.Author: George Sheridan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Chromebook because of the price and reviews of its speed and performance. 4 months later, it has not let me down. It runs smooth as ever and is lightning fast. I use this for web browsing and surfing the web over my Dell Inspiron 15, which I bought to work on excel projects and download language software (I want to learn Spanish, and I needed Windows to install such a program). You can use a Chromebook to work on excel or word through Onedrive for FREE, but it is not very typical, as the screen is small and it does not perform all the functions it would on a windows computer with Microsoft office. I do know they have Office 365, but I have yet to try it on a Chromebook. I think Google has a bright future with laptops, if they could start producing tablets or more powerful laptops, I would definitely invest in one.All in all, buy a Chromebook. It is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Michael Simmons
Reviews.Content: This was bought for my wife's birthday. I put a good amount of time in finding the correct one for her.  She wanted a small computer, but one that did the same as a big one.  In the Chromebook  C720, that is just what I got. It is easy to use, at 11.5" it is small enough to handle in your lap and does a great job.  I would recommend this one to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I really like this
Reviews.Content: Great price and amazing little laptop.  i only use it for internet so that is great.  also , its light weight, less than 2 pounds.  Smart purchase.

Reviews.Title: Online software has come a long way
Reviews.Author: CAC1031
Reviews.Content: This is my second Chromebook and it is definitely a step up from the Samsung 303--faster, better battery life and nicer screen and speakers.I am all in with Chrome OS and will soon get a Chromebox to replace my bloated, sluggish Windows desktop.  I have found that there is literally nothing that I personally want or need to do on a computer that cannot now be down in the cloud. I have used Windows programs for years for amateur photo, film and sound editing but now there are terrific online alternatives (for the most part free) for all those things--for example, Pixlr Editor, WeVideo and AudioSauna, respectively.  There are online programs for business needs, file conversion and of course Google's office suite, with its new integration with third-party add-ons, has all the functionality that 95% of users could need.If you want to find any online alternative to your local software just Google what you want to do followed by "online"  and chances are you'll find various options. But the best part is that the future is even brighter with the functionality of the OS constantly growing.  Rather than having a machine that slows down and demands more troubleshooting with time,  you have one that is getting better with each background update.There are some people who will need one of the traditional OSes for a while longer--certain professionals and gamers--but for the vast majority of users who are willing to try alternatives to their legacy programs,  the benefits of Chrome OS--speed, security, lack of frustrating technical problems--is well worth the switch.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: J. Beacher "JB"
Reviews.Content: It feels more expensive than $200. The battery life is great; over 8 hours consistently. I use a lot of google's services and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Carrie Robinson
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of a product before, but I purposely signed back in to Amazon.com in order to write this one.  Upon receiving the laptop, I was up and running within 1 minute.  The Acer C720 Chromebook is perfect!  It is lightweight yet durable.  I have already dropped it three times and it is still working perfectly.  All of the applications are user friendly and you can jump from application to application with ease.  I absolutely recommend this laptop for anyone that is looking for an inexpensive every day PC.  If I had any complaints at all, it would be that it doesnt have a DVD drive.  And I am a little confused about why the speakers are located at the bottom of the device...but other than that - this was an ideal purchase!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: robert fierst
Reviews.Content: Great laptop without all the hassles of Windows. Does everything I need and more. Fast bootup, no need for anti-virus, long battery life, automatic updates every 6 weeks and simple to use.  Best of all the price.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Sandy M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Chromebook as another method to connect to the internet.  It was the easiest setup.  Had it up, running, and connected to our wifi in less than 5 minutes.  The battery life is amazing.  For us it is about 10 hours.  Using the microphone to search for sites or items makes surfing easier than ever imagined.We were so impressed with the speed and ease of use that we ordered a second one to use along with our desktop.Going into settings and adding our classic printer was also amazing.I would absolutely recommend this to anyone that does a lot of web surfing and emailing.

Reviews.Title: This is a computer for everyone. NOT for hardcore users
Reviews.Author: Omar Morales
Reviews.Content: It is a very good "laptop", I recommend this only to people which have already adapted their computing life to an online way of life. This is not for hardcore gaming, not for having loads of music files but the google drive is a wonderful experience, which supplies all the harddrive needs. For the computer itself, it is wonderful, small light and pretty straight forward to use. I recommend this computer to the average browser and ever college students.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value!
Reviews.Author: PL
Reviews.Content: I've read too many reviews that whine about this and that supposedly missing from the C720.  It all makes me laugh.  What do people expect for $199?  I expected a lot less than I got.  The C720 is lightening fast, powers up immediately, and is child's play to use.  It even found my iPhone hot spot without a hitch, so I can take the laptop anywhere there isn't a dedicated Wi-Fi signal.  Amazingly, I plugged in my wireless Microsoft Mouse and it worked immediately.  This laptop is a wonder of simplicity, speed, and portability.  It's light yet sturdy enough to last.  Most of what I do is Chrome based to begin with, so this is perfect for me.  Word documents I've moved to Google Drive or open in my email are perfectly readable.  Same with PDF files.  I have a new desktop for Microsoft intensive tasks, an iPhone and iPad for causal use, and now the C720 for intermediate work.  I bought this to replace my two outdated XP Dell machines--and I couldn't be happier.  I especially like the no worries anti-virus controls built into the background of the C720.  If I lose this, I won't be happy but I won't be out all that much money.  It's almost a disposable laptop--and a fine one at that.  For a Chromebook this simply can't be beat.  Buy one.  You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook, but power issues out of the box.
Reviews.Author: J. Temple
Reviews.Content: I want to give 5 stars, but for now I cannot.  I purchased the C720 on 2/8/14 and within the first 48 hours I experienced a few "crashes."  I chalked them up as crashes and within the first week focused on finding a bad Chrome extension.  I eventually disabled all extensions but the issue still persisted.  About once a day I would experience a "crash."The next step was to contact a Chrome Ninja who did some troubleshooting with me and eventually had me do a powerwash.  After trying this and sending some system data they indicated my Chromebook had been put in developer mode and that they could not help me.  This was interesting because a) it was a new Chromebook and b) while I know what developer mode is I certainly did not perform the steps at any time to enter into developer mode.  After explaining this to the Chrome Ninja he reviewed the information I sent again and said the Chromebook was no longer in developer mode but had been put in dev mode at some point in the past.  Given that, he said the only way for him to continue to assist was for me to do a full recovery of the machine.  No big deal, I made my USB recovery disk and completed the task and started over.After performing the recovery, the machine was still randomly "crashing" 1-2 times per day.  After the Chrome Ninja reviewed the latest system info he replied back and said I have a power issue and that I'd need to contact Acer for support/repair.  What I ignorantly wasn't realizing is that the Chromebook wasn't necessarily crashing, it was completely shutting down.  I should have realized that given that I had to press the power button each time it happened for the Chromebook to boot back up, but I just wasn't putting it together I guess since this is my first Chromebook.Now that I realized what was happening (thank you Chrome Ninja), I contacted Acer for repair since I had unfortunately purchased the Chromebook from Best Buy and I was past my 14 day return window.  At first, Acer wanted me to pay for shipping to their facility in Texas.  While I was annoyed they would even think I would pay for shipping (I told them the Chromebook was brand new and less than 30 days old) it was admittedly not that hard to get them to pay for the shipping.  I simply asked the Acer support representative and it took him about 5 minutes to confirm a free shipping label would be approved.  After a brief hold, he came back and said he was emailing me a shipping label.So, that's pretty much where I stand.  I have shipped my brand new Chromebook that I've used maybe a dozen times off to Acer for repair.  While I consider myself an understanding person, I'm quite disappointed that I'm now without my device for a period of time.  I can only hope that they actually repair it correctly and that the issue does not occur again.  Given the random nature of the issue, I'm skeptical at best.  I am hopeful though given the fact that there are so many positive reviews for this device I have to be an anomaly.I will update my review and rating once I get the device back from Acer.  If anyone else experiences a new machine that just randomly shuts down, don't wait until the return period is over... just swap it out for a new one immediately!UPDATE: 4/15/2014-----------------My Chromebook has been in repair with Acer twice now.  The first time, regarding the power issue above, they simply "Reloaded OS" and sent it back.  I had told them, more than once, that I had already done that and it didn't help.  After receiving the Chromebook back in late March, I began to experience the same issue of the Chromebook just randomly powering off on the very day that I received it back from repair.  So, I immediately called Acer support and they immediately, without trouble, sent me a shipping label (again) to send it back for repair (again).  After just 1 day of having the Chromebook back in my possession, I turned around and shipped it off again.I received the Chromebook back today, 4/15, with a note reading, "Unable to replicate symptoms of the unit shutting down.  Unit remained powered on while streaming videos from youtube for more than 24 hours.  No trouble found."  Fair enough, but at this point I'm just waiting for the issue to happen again, at which time I will send it in... again.  Luckily, Google has been very helpful and they are helping me figure out what the issue is.  I just have to wait for it to happen again and they're going to analyze the data I send them from a feedback report.I'm trying to remain patient as I know my issue is difficult to replicate and is very random, but I would love to be able to talk to a more technical person at Acer to explain my issue as I believe things are getting "lost in translation..."  The other issue is I'm thinking it's battery related, and I would be the Acer tech left the Chromebook plugged in, and I've only experienced the issue while on battery power.Given the above... I've updated my rating to 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Easiest computer I've ever used!
Reviews.Author: Eileen M. Kelly
Reviews.Content: I'm new to Chromebooks, but I was pleasantly surprised by the ease of use and quick start-up time. Having separate profiles for each user helps, too: I don't have to wade through my boyfriend's files to get to my own.The small size and lightness are a plus. I can literally take it anywhere!The only thing I don't like is that I can't do anything offline. Maybe there is a way and I just haven't found it yet, but right now I can only use it where there's a Wi-Fi connection, and that limits what I can do.All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Best $200 spent!
Reviews.Author: Corinne
Reviews.Content: I've had the same laptop since highschool... its old, slow, and clunky. I'm now in grad school and needed a laptop that is quick and lightweight. The Acer C720 Chromebook is PERFECT. It has everything I need to complete my work. I can write papers, research, even print wirelessly. There are tons of apps. I'm so glad I found this affordable chromebook. I love it.

Reviews.Title: NO COMPLAINTS
Reviews.Author: VACATION TIME
Reviews.Content: WORTH THE PRICE I PAID..NICE LITTLE EMAIL INTERNET COMPUTER THAT DOESN'T GET FILLED WITH VIRUSES LIKE WINDOWS. I HATE WINDOWS

Reviews.Title: Amazing Laptop
Reviews.Author: Jonnie
Reviews.Content: Seriously not even gonna write a whole report about this machine, l'm gonna break down to you guys. I've owned Apple and windows laptops, but this one is the one for a college student.

Reviews.Title: Everything I needed
Reviews.Author: Lianne Akers
Reviews.Content: I have been searching for a new laptop after mine finally died. I needed something to supplement my phone and tablet since most mobile websites are limiting and I needed to be able to create and share power points, word docs, etc. I was hesitant at first to try a Chromebook. I wasn't sure how I would complete work projects without having the Office Suite, or how I felt about having to work almost completely online. What I found was that this little device does everything I need it to. I can create and share spread sheets, presentations, and docs using Google. It loads incredibly fast, it's lightweight and compact, and easy to navigate. Plus, I am almost always somewhere with wifi connectivity, so that has really become a non-issue. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Melonie A. Flomer "Writer, gamer, geek. Frien...
Reviews.Content: Responsive, easy to use keyboard and trackpad.  I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift, and now I want one.The only improvement I would suggest is making one with a 14" screen.  Hubby is a tall fellow with large hands, and I am sure he would appreciate a larger Chromebook.  All the high ratings the Acer C720 has received are well deserved.

Reviews.Title: acer c720  great nifty machine for thge price
Reviews.Author: Reuben Pillay
Reviews.Content: The c720 by acer is a great nifty browsing machine. I opened 12 window tabs and had video running in 8 of them. It was all seamless. On only 2GB ram and 16 GB hard drive , it functioned optimally.Totally recommend

Reviews.Title: Love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Langdon "Billy Shears"
Reviews.Content: I had a Nexus but had to prop it up to read the news in the AM.  This is like a 11" iPad that has a built in keyboard.  Oh yeah - for $200.  No hard drive but I don't need it.  I just want to surf.  Oh and it's the fastest computer I've ever used in my life.

Reviews.Title: The best $200 I've spent
Reviews.Author: Tom Carrio
Reviews.Content: Chrome OS was lacking only in the sense of Skype, so I installed Crouton onboard to have a chroot installation of Ubuntu alongside. For what I've paid this is absolutely the best device I could ask for with what I use, which is mostly cloud-based Docs, web-browsing and video calls. Only 16 GB of storage which is great.Note: Had issues trying to install ChrUbuntu. Crouton works perfectly fine and I don't have to ever restart my computer to boot up into Ubuntu either. With only 2GB of RAM I'd suggest against using both OS' heavily simultaneously but I haven't had any issues with this laptop yet at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!  Must have 2nd Computer
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I am not going to dive into tech specs -- its easy to compare those.But from use case perspective, this is my favorite laptop / computer ever.I have my workhorse desktop for actual sit-down work, but I would rather be doing everything on my Acer Chromebook C720.Boots in seconds (sooooooo nice), does everything I need 95% of the time (i.e., obviously don't use for graphic processing), and on the road it is a wonder.  In that almost everything I do is cloud based (Evernote, Google Drive, Gmail, etc.) -- this computer is all you need.  And I love the keyboard.Build is a touch on the lower-cost end, but it is a lower cost computer that I throw in my bag and just go.  If it breaks (which I doubt it ever will) I'll just get another.  And along those lines, I bought 3 of these for co-workers for Christmas -- sharing the love.This is perfect tech - better, cheaper, faster and more usable.Just get it,

Reviews.Title: Amazing way to Compute!
Reviews.Author: k
Reviews.Content: My MacBook pro bit the dust.  Sad day truly...but when considering my options to re-tech my home life, I realized that as fabulous of a product the Apple was, I simply did not use or need all of the Apple specific bells and whistles.  And the idea of a PC saddled with the dreadful Windows 8 was not appealing.  I decided to try a total "in the clouds" option of computing and went with the Acer C720 Chromebook.  I love it!Fast...super fast.  Like lightening!  Like a teenager trying to get out of shoveling a snowy driveway.  Like a seagull stealing cheetos at the beach.  You get the idea.  Open the Chromebook and faster than I can blink it is up and running and ready for action.  The App selection in the Chrome Store is not as broad as Apples but there was everything that I used frequently prior to the tragic demise of my MacBook.  Extremely simple to use and understand, but I can totally see where the "in the clouds" approach is going to be even more functional and secure than a hard drive.  ALSO I spend hours with this running on my lap and it doesn't heat up.  (Whereas my MacBook left red burn marks on my legs if I didn't have it on a board.)The only caveat for the Acer...the screen quality leaves a little bit to be desired.  It is not crystal clear and sharp.My daughter's Dell laptop is physically falling apart but still functioning well...(eight years running so no complaints)...when the Dell goes I am replacing it with another Chromebook.  How can you go wrong with $199 machine that does it all?

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the middle school student
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A Brunner
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter.  She loves it for school, social media, and watching Netflix. We like the fact that we don't have to have virus software and that the updates are automatic. Works great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought this in order to replace a 2010 Macbook Pro. After the logicboard failed, I was not interested in dropping another $1200 on a computer. This thing really works well, the touchpad is great, and is surprisingly fast. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an internet cruising computer, or even small word processing projects.

Reviews.Title: Opinion of Acer C720 laptop
Reviews.Author: twyla
Reviews.Content: The mouse cursor is hard to move and stay on the spot that you are wanting information and the keys are hard to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: april cronenberg
Reviews.Content: As long as you are looking for a chrome book and not a work machine, this little guy is perfect. And as a bonus, the speakers are quite loud!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product for a great price
Reviews.Author: Bakul Mehta
Reviews.Content: I ordered this laptop for my wife. Her major work is to browse the interenet and check emails. I bought 2G version. It is thin, lightweight and fast. It is similar to a smartphone but with a large screen, keyboard and full blown browser. Since it uses intel's haswell architecture CPU, provides battery life of almost 10 hrs. Truly love it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic value for money
Reviews.Author: S douglas
Reviews.Content: This little laptop was a present for my kid. It is the fastest computer in the house. Starts up really quickly. Meets all our computer expectations

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this Chromebook
Reviews.Author: M. Joppru
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook is awesome.  For $200 it is much better than any other laptop I have for browsing the web.  It boots up in seconds, feels substantial and is really fast.It can be used to view and modify spreadsheets and ppts too.I don't think it can replace a destop / laptop for me completely yet, but I am using it for almost everything.

Reviews.Title: I love Amazon
Reviews.Author: Teresa Delgado
Reviews.Content: I love this computer it comes with virus protection and it is very easy to use. I got it for a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Really greate device for this price.
Reviews.Author: ZHAN CHENXING
Reviews.Content: Advantages:1. The price.2. The touchpad is really greate. You don't need a mouse. Two fingers to scrool, three or four fingers to switch tab. You don't need to take a mouse around with you.3. It's fast. It's as fast as my two years old Macbook.4. It boots fast. In about 7 seconds.5. The input method is really greate.Disadvantages:1. The screen! It will be a perfect device if it has a better screen.2. The font for chinese is not as good as Macbook's.3. The charger is a little big, I think.4. The keyboard is somehow soft.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: JGJoy
Reviews.Content: Small, light, fast, good battery life, great display, does what I need -- exceeded my expectations.I've used the remote desktop via the chrome browser to access a windows 7 computer without issues.I've used developer mode and crouton to run some Ubuntu shell scripts on the box itself (also using dict/dictd on cli).Fine with external mouse.  Keyboard is good.A little effort required to find things like keyboard shortcuts ("delete" key is actually Alt-Backspace, e.g.,) and instructions for odds and ends, but unsurprisingly, Google search results have been on target and quickly got me what I needed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Jon "Jon"
Reviews.Content: Okay, I spent weeks, no months laboring over whether to replace my laptop (monitor no longer works) with another windows based laptop or go Chromebook.  I am already heavily entrenched into the Google ecosystem and consequently the Chromebook was a big draw.  For those not quite entrenched in Google, I can understand why a Chromebook may not be as appealing.Let me be clear:  I already have a work windows based laptop that I can do various things if necessary.  What I mainly needed was something to more easily type long emails, etc on.  We mainly use it for the internet and doing more robust web browsing when the android tablet just won't quite cut it.  The Chromebook fits the bill to the "T"!One review I saw about windows based laptops vs Chromebooks that i agree with: Chromebooks do not need as robust hardware because they don't have the heavy and complicated windows software that needs a fast processor to operate.  2 gig RAM is more than enough.  And the Haswell based processor is plenty zippy and keeps the laptop running for days for me with periodic use.The selling point for me?  Once I realized I can access my old laptop with my Chromebook using Google's "Chrome Remote Desktop", I was in business.  This way I can access my windows laptop and my keystrokes on my Chromebook control my old windows based laptop and my old laptop sends the screen to my Chromebook's monitor.  It then looks like on my Chromebook that I'm working on my old laptop.All for $199, half of a new windows-based laptop?  How can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL piece of laptop
Reviews.Author: Santosh Balan
Reviews.Content: I brought this as a birthday gift for my daughter 9 year old.  What was surprising is that my wife who has a Sony Viao laptop also prefers to use the Chromebook when she can.  My daughter hit the ground running with the Chromebook os and did not require any training.  This serves all her needs and i do not have to worry about virus, patches or a corrupt os, boots in 7 seconds and an 8 hour battery life is icing on the cake.My wife has expressed that she is willing to take a Chromebook for her birthday gift to replace her Sony Viao.  Although this may not be a full blown computer, this serves 100% need of 80% of the users.  for the remaining 20% of the users like me who have specialized need for software for professional reasons, you always have the macs and window pcs and the associated pain that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: Okay I am sold...
Reviews.Author: Lucian A. Sperta
Reviews.Content: Just got this little baby and turned it on, HDMI plugged in...awesome connection with WIFI, watching YoutTube now...awesome view only 720 but real nice, my other Dell lap top was connected to my T.V. Dell Windows 8, now I can take that with me and use it while this little Google boy will do all I need for only internet stuff. Nice look, nice feel, take some getting used to, smaller than what appears on Amazon. Looks like a mini lap top. I thought it would be bigger in size...I love it.

Reviews.Title: Better alternative
Reviews.Author: MBH1
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with speed, screen quality, battery life and overall utility. It's a great product and priced right. Highly recommend this for a coffee table surfing appliance. Great for emails, surfing, you tube vids, online banking and limited games. Perfect, but would prefer the ability to control content better. Kids have unrestricted use of the web, wish the ability to block adult or inappropriate content was possible.

Reviews.Title: The beauty of simplicity
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got 95% of my work done without the hassle of software updates, virus, slow start-ups, memory leaks. Light to carry and long battery life. It has easily become my coach computer and Starbucks computer.

Reviews.Title: wish I'd gotten this before I got my regular netbook
Reviews.Author: Kamali
Reviews.Content: I went in skeptical, I will not lie. I read the reviews and I went...eh, never as good as they say. But the Acer Chromebook is everything everyone says it is, and then some. I'm talking speed that's, frankly, amazing. I'm talking multiple windows with no issues, or even multiple video streaming sites at the same time with no lag whatsoever. It actually boots in less than 7 seconds, has some decent speakers and, other than it being app-based, it's comparable to a regular laptop.Considering that I bought it for classroom use, I definitely came out on top.All in all, this might the best purchase I ever made and this thing is worth every freaking penny.

Reviews.Title: STOP AND LISTEN!
Reviews.Author: Troopie
Reviews.Content: This Chrome is awesome! I got it for 199, and I am loving it, the only con I have is the keyboard is flat, and I am use to a desk top keyboard. Reviews.Title: Seniors - don't hesitate to buy one!
Reviews.Author: Kate Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: After spending months thinking about buying a Chromebook I finally decided to do it and couldn't be happier.  It is super simple to set up and use (took me less than five minutes) and I find I'm using it almost all the time instead of my laptop--it is SO MUCH faster!  One of the reasons I hesitated to buy it was because of the size--I was worried about being able to see well with this smaller screen but that hasn't been a problem at all due to sharp high-quality resolution.  Another concern had been typing on the smaller keyboard and that isn't a problem at all.  I find it very comfortable and easy to  use.  Google Docs makes it possible to do word processing without Office (which is much more difficult to use anyway!)  The touchpad/mouse was much easier to use than I expected, too.  Just overall terrific for any age, but  I would highly recommend it for other seniors as a low cost way to browse the internet, check e-mail, and watch those Amazon Instant Videos!

Reviews.Title: Great for my money!

Can't beat it for $200.

Reviews.Title: An unbelievable bargain! (with updates and tips)
Reviews.Author: Phantom-X
Reviews.Content: A grand slam chromebook at a spectacular price!  I've never owned a chromebook, but I'm so glad I purchased this.Benefits:* Speed - connects to WiFi instantly and runs all web-based tasks as good as my desktop PC.* Instant boot up* Immediate access to Google Drive, Google Email, etc.* Lightweight* Battery Life (8.5 hours)* Quick charge time (charged very quickly from 82% to full today when I received the product)* Chrome Remote Desktop -- this app allows me to connect directly to my desktop PC (which has Windows 7).  The app works very well, and this essentially means that I HAVE FULL ACCESS TO WIN 7 WHENEVER I WANT!Zero cons at this price.  This is now going to be my little workhorse computer.Acer has really hit this one out of the park.**UPDATE #1**I've been using this for a few days now.  I'm still very impressed with this machine.  I really cannot state how great the battery is:  I literally went through almost 2 full days of use with this on a single charge (not continuous use, but off and on for hours at a time for the entire two days).I also earned 100 GB of free Google space - bringing my total Google Cloud space up to 130 GB (all for free).I've been speed-testing the WiFi.  The machine achieves excellent speeds (same as my desktop PC).  This may be standard nowadays, but my cell phone and other laptops I've tried often have a slightly inferior WiFi connection.  So I'm happy to report that this thing achieves full speeds over WiFi (and really connects almost instantly to it).There are a few things I dislike, but it's not with the machine itself.  Google Docs is missing a few features that I would have assumed standard (e.g., no ability to use a section break).Also, I really like Google Chrome Remote Desktop, but there is one issue with the screen flickering when I try to stream StarCraft 2 on my chromebook.  I'm not sure what the reason is, but it may have to do with my desktop PC having two monitors (dual screen).  Not quite sure yet.  Otherwise, Google Chrome Remote Desktop is brilliant!One thing I noticed:  If you have multiple email accounts with Google, you'll need to create a separate user to access them.  It's not a bad thing, but it is a necessity.Another thing:  There is no "delete" key on this keyboard.  That may be standard on laptops, but I used that key all the time on my desktop PC (and I miss it!).In sum, I'm still very glad I purchased this Chromebook.  People try to ding things by saying the screen is of poor quality, or that the keyboard is bad, etc.  I DO NOT agree.  The screen looks great to me, and the only thing I can say about the keyboard is that it's a little smaller than a full-sized keyboard (standalone).  But I can type on it just fine (as I'm doing now).All in all, a terrific machine at a terrific price!  Still 5/5 for me!I'm getting ready to travel across the country for approximately 2 weeks.  I will post another update on my experience using it on the go.  Cheers!**Update #2**I'm on holiday and recently flew from Ohio to California with a connection in Texas (American Airlines flights).  GoGo in flight WiFi worked and it was FREE!A few things:*It only worked from Texas to California (no service from Ohio to Texas)*The overall speed was very hit or miss.  One second web pages / music would be loading decently, and then it would come to a grinding halt.  This was, admittedly, rather annoying.*When I had no connection, I noticed that I could still make changes to files I had stored in Google Docs.  For some reason, these files would still open even though I had no internet connection.  I'm very baffled by this, but it's an incredible plus.  Basically, all the changes I made were synced once the connection resumed.  This is an AWESOME feature because it allows me to work despite the lack of an active connection.Other general thoughts:*The speed of this chromebook is incredible.  A particularly nice feature is the boot-up time.  If you open the chromebook, it resumes instantly.*Again, I have to comment on the wicked good battery life.  I cannot remember the last time I charged this device, but I can tell you it was BEFORE I left for vacation, which translates to about 5-7 days.  This is with full time usage during my flight (several hours) and also moderate usage before and after the flight.  As of right now, after about a week of light / moderate use, I've got 22% battery life / about 2 hours left.  WICKED GOOD BATTERY LIFE!*A pleasure to travel with due to its slim and lightweight design.I was hoping I'd be getting some more work in during my trip, but we all know how that goes.  I will post another update again in the future.Still 5/5.**Update #3**I've had a few more thoughts since my purchase.  First off, still love this machine in pretty much every possible way.A minor downside, at the moment, is Google Chrome Remote Desktop.  First off, the app works great FOR THE MOST PART.  However, certain tasks / applications ARE SLOW.  The trouble is that I have not figured out a way to fix this issue.  I'm not sure if it's a hardware issue, a software issue, or a bandwidth issue.  I've tried reducing my color depth and eliminated all visual enhancements on the Win 7 machine, but it hasn't fixed the issue.I dug around and it turns out that Google seems to be aware of this issue, suggesting that I'm not the only one experiencing this and also that they are currently working to resolve the performance degradation during Chrome Remote Desktop.The best way I can describe the performance issues is this:  Laggy.  The cursor will sometimes lag behind, typing will sometimes be delayed, and applications will stutter a bit.  It seems to get worse depending on where I am using my chromebook, which makes me suspect that it might be a bandwidth issue.  Of course, I'm not 100% sure and it may be a combination of things.  I do hope that they resolve the issue sometime soon!Otherwise, nothing majorly new to report at this time.  It's still a workhorse bargain of a machine as I outlined in my previous reviews, and it's most certainly still one of the best electronics / laptop purchases I've ever made (if not THE best computer purchasing decision I've ever made!).**Update #4**Quick tip:  To avoid the loud mouse click when using the trackpad, push down slightly above the left mouse key.  The button will not depress, and thus will not make noise; yet, if you find the sweet spot, you can successfully click the mouse!  :)I also wanted to say that my GoGo WiFi was much better on my return flights (previously, it was kinda slow and in one leg not even available).Also, Google Chrome Remote is great in terms of reliability, but needs to be updated for better speed.  Also, when using Chrome Remote in full screen mode, a really annoying display box telling you you're in full screen mode pops up whenever you hover your mouse near the top of the screen.  This is really ANNOYING and should be eliminated!

Reviews.Title: I. LOVE. THIS. COMPUTER.
Reviews.Author: Kaytra Parkman
Reviews.Content: I am a bit of a technology maniac, and what I mean by that is, I will research until my eyes practically bleed to make sure I'm know exactly what I'm getting and that it suits my needs. After meticulously comparing all the Chromebooks within my price-range on the market and testing them out in person at Best Buy, I decided on this one. I am SO glad I did! I currently have a Dell Desktop computer, and an HP laptop. This is perfect for sticking in your bag on the go, taking with you on vacation, the coffee shop, school, WHEREVER. It's even more convenient to take to bed or on the couch because it's so freaking light as a feather! It doesn't heat up or make any noise. The display is great (no glare), plays HD YouTube fairly well (THE BUFFERING AND LOADING TIME IS INCREDIBLE IT"S SO FAST), and has pretty loud sound considering the size.Not only that, but it's super thin, and the battery life is mind-blowing. It just lasts forever. And I know several people on the internet complain about its processing power, but I don't see the issue. I have had TONS of tabs open at once with no problem. The only thing that gave me a bit of trouble in that area was a ton of tabs + trying to play Spotify (it had a bit of difficulty buffering).All-Google interface takes a few days to get used to, but once you do, it's so easy.Don't forget that this is a Chromebook though, and you cannot really download any software or programs. But you get what you pay for, and lemme tell ya, it's a total bang for your buck. Really can't go wrong with one of these. I am very happy!

Reviews.Author: Amazonian Consumer
Reviews.Content: I have three acer Chromebook C720 models which only differ in the amount of RAM and SSD capacity: 2/16, 2/32, and 4/16. After using them for over six months, I deem the basic model is already more than sufficient for my daily use, with about 15 tabs in the Chrome browser.The Haswell architecture Celeron CPU is both capable and power-efficient. The basic configuration Chromebook C720 with 2Gb RAM and 16 GB SSD can run fast-action 720p HD video (example: Youtube video of squash or badminton sports), even in full-screen mode, without any performance issue. Scrolling through complex web pages (example: arstechnica.com, theverge.com) is also never a problem. These observations are made in the presence of 20 browser tabs.The C720 cold boots to the login screen in 8 seconds.It has a HDMI port for easy connection to a larger monitor or flat-screen TV. Other ports included are USB 2.0X1, USB 3.0X1, 3.5mm audio/microphone combo, SD card reader, and Kensington lock.For $200, this is the best Chromebook, even the best notebook value that you can buy. It is only about 1/4 to 1/5 the cost of an Apple Macbook Air 11-inch. It is more versatile than a tablet and only costs at least half as much.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Carmichael
Reviews.Content: When my last laptop wouldn't power up anymore, I started looking for a new one. The only thing my laptop has been used for in the past couple years is letting my daughter watch youtube videos or play games on PBS's web site. I also occasionally surf the web and maybe once in a while do a video chat/Skype.With those requirements in mind, I wanted to get the cheapest laptop I could find. I am not a big Windows 8 fan (my now-dead laptop was running Linux) and of course Macs are too expensive, so I started looking at Chromebooks. To be honest this was the cheapest one I could find with decent reviews, and at only $199 I thought I'd give it a try.I'm pretty impressed with ChromeOS as a whole. It boots very quickly, and this C720 has a good battery life (4 or 5 hours with youtube watching). The screen quality isn't the best but the resolution is acceptable. As you would expect, pretty much everything is based around Chrome and it all works pretty well.One thing that is a downside of ChromeOS and not this particular product is that since everything revolves around Chrome, any Chrome extensions you install have the opportunity to mess the system up pretty good. After a couple weeks of really poor performance after installing (and uninstalling) some extensions, I did a system restore (which was very easy/fast from the menu). After that, I just didn't install any extensions and it has been working great ever since.The device is really light and easy to carry around. It doesn't feel exceptionally sturdy.. I'm not sure how many drops it will survive.Sure I'd like it to be a little bit faster, have a higher resolution, more RAM, etc. But for the price point, this really is an amazing product.

It doesn't have several commonly used keys such as ... DELETE, F11, F12, PgUp, PgDn etc. Not sure what they were thinking.

Reviews.Title: Fast, convenient, and flimsy
Reviews.Author: Anneliese Marvelous
Reviews.Content: This is a great affordable little machine for users who do a lot of writing and reading on the go and are comfortable working with cloud storage via Google Drive. It's fast and reliable, incredibly lightweight and fairly easy to use. I recommend it highly as a portable second computer for a moderately tech-savvy person. I wouldn't recommend it to someone as an only computer or to someone who isn't comfortable occasionally googling around to figure out a problem.My biggest complaints are not reasons to avoid purchasing this Chromebook, but things I'd wish I'd known prior to my purchase. While the apps available through the Google Play store are overall very helpful, switching between non-Google file types can be tricky. Mostly for me that's dealing with Windows documents, such as .docx. I've also had some trouble with media files, especially video and sound, that I'm still trying to sort out. Streaming works well, but opening previously downloaded files is not so simple.The biggest criticism I've encountered in about a month of ownership is just how flimsy the hardware is. It's something a few reviews mentioned, but it didn't really jump out at me until I got my own. About two weeks after I bought my Chromebook, my medium-sized dog bumped it off the table and stepped on the (closed) Chromebook. It booted up and works absolutely fine, but the upper-left hand corner of the screen is a grey block and there's a weird green line running down the screen. I would definitely recommend buying the purchase protection plan for this laptop. I am filing a claim with my credit card in hopes it'll be covered.I might be slightly biased because my ASUS K50 is an absolute tank and has weathered a lot more damage in 6 years of ownership. It also weighs 6 times as much, which is why I upgraded to the Chromebook.Still, I like this machine a lot and I'd buy it again. I carry it almost everywhere for work and I love how fast and convenient it is. I will be investing in a good cover, though.
